transportAdvice: The Raleigh-Durham area is largely car-dependent, and renting a vehicle is the most practical way to get around between the two cities and surrounding suburbs. A regional bus network exists but has limited coverage of tourist areas, and taxis or ride-hail services are available, though walking is only practical within specific downtown districts.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally cold with a chance of light rain or rare winter mix; pack layers for chilly days.
Still cool with variable conditions; occasional warm spells hint at approaching spring but frost remains possible.
Spring begins with warming temperatures and blooming trees, though rain showers become more frequent.
Pleasant and mild with colorful spring foliage; a great month to explore outdoor spaces with comfortable temperatures.
Warm and increasingly humid with occasional afternoon thunderstorms; outdoor activities are still very enjoyable.
Hot and humid with regular afternoon thunderstorms; stay hydrated and plan outdoor activities for the morning.
The hottest month of the year with high humidity and frequent afternoon storms; air conditioning is a welcome relief.
Remains hot and muggy with similar conditions to July; thunderstorms are common in the afternoon hours.
Gradual cooling begins but humidity lingers; early fall foliage starts appearing by late in the month.
One of the best months to visit with crisp air, low rain, and beautiful fall foliage across the region.
Cooling noticeably with occasional rain; fall colors peak early in the month before trees go bare.
Cold and wintry with a small chance of frost or light snow; festive holiday atmosphere in downtown areas.
